1.text: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.

2.text: Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” He answered, “So you say.”

3.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.

4.text: Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!”

5.text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.

6.text: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

7.text: There was one called Barabbas, bound with those who had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

8.text: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.

9.text: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

10.text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

11.text: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.

12.text: Pilate again asked them, “What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?”

14.text: Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out exceedingly, “Crucify him!”

15.text: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.

16.text: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.

17.text: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.

18.text: They began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”

19.text: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.

20.text: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off of him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.

21.text: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

22.text: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, “The place of a skull.”

23.text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn’t take it.

24.text: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.

25.text: It was the third hour, and they crucified him.

26.text: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

27.text: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

28.text: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was numbered with transgressors.”

29.text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,

30.text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!”

31.text: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, “He saved others. He can’t save himself.

32.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him.” Those who were crucified with him insulted him.

33.text: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

34.text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is, being interpreted, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

35.text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Behold, he is calling Elijah.”

36.text: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Let him be. Let’s see whether Elijah comes to take him down.”

37.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.

38.text: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.

39.text: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”

40.text: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

41.text: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.

42.text: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

43.text: Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for the Kingdom of God, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.

44.text: Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.

45.text: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

46.text: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

47.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.
